headline: Axon shares rise as Taser-maker's profit gets boost from government spending
summary: Axon Enterprise shares jumped 16% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the Taser-maker reported fourth‑quarter profit ‌above Wall Street expectations, on strong demand for its security ‌devices and software products. Increased federal investment on immigration enforcement along with corporate spending on ​executive security have aided demand for Axon, which makes body-worn cameras and digital evidence management systems used by companies and governments. Axon's 2025 bookings came at $7.4 billion, up 46% from a year ago, with fourth‑quarter ‌bookings rising about 50%, ⁠the company said on Tuesday.

content.title: Axon shares rise as Taser-maker's profit gets boost from government spending
content.summary: Axon Enterprise shares jumped 16% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the Taser-maker reported fourth‑quarter profit ‌above Wall Street expectations, on strong demand for its security ‌devices and software products. Increased federal investment on immigration enforcement along with corporate spending on ​executive security have aided demand for Axon, which makes body-worn cameras and digital evidence management systems used by companies and governments. Axon's 2025 bookings came at $7.4 billion, up 46% from a year ago, with fourth‑quarter ‌bookings rising about 50%, ⁠the company said on Tuesday.

headline: Axon Surges 16% as Blockbuster Bookings and AI Growth Silence the Bears
summary: Axon Enterprise (NASDAQ: AXON) is surging roughly 19% in premarket trading this morning after the company posted a strong Q4 beat Tuesday evening. Yesterday we were watching whether bookings momentum and AI-driven software growth could justify the stock’s battered valuation after a steep multi-month decline. The answer from investors this morning is a clear yes. ... Axon Surges 16% as Blockbuster Bookings and AI Growth Silence the Bears

headline: Axon Stock Surges. How This Taser Maker Is Getting an AI Boost.
summary: Axon Enterprise shares surged ahead of the bell Wednesday, after investors in the taser maker and software developer digested its success expanding into AI services for law enforcement clients.  It also makes body cameras.  It used its earnings report late Tuesday to share details of strong software and services revenue growth.

headline: Taser Maker Axon’s AI Pivot Triggers Stock Surge
summary: Shares of Axon Enterprise are soaring after the company revealed during its fourth-quarter earnings call that its AI tools are being adopted at a rapid pace, driving over $750 million in new bookings and helping the company soundly beat Wall Street expectations.  Axon's AI plan—designed to cut down on police paperwork and streamline digital evidence—accounted for 10% of overall bookings, said Axon president Joshua Isner on a Tuesday call with investors.  “For two years, we have recognized that for software companies to win in the age of AI, they must convert their existing customer base to AI users before someone else does,” Isner said.

content.title: Taser Maker Axon’s AI Pivot Triggers Stock Surge
content.summary: Shares of Axon Enterprise are soaring after the company revealed during its fourth-quarter earnings call that its AI tools are being adopted at a rapid pace, driving over $750 million in new bookings and helping the company soundly beat Wall Street expectations.  Axon's AI plan—designed to cut down on police paperwork and streamline digital evidence—accounted for 10% of overall bookings, said Axon president Joshua Isner on a Tuesday call with investors.  “For two years, we have recognized that for software companies to win in the age of AI, they must convert their existing customer base to AI users before someone else does,” Isner said.

headline: Axon Disarms AI Software Doubts; How Taser Maker Wins In AI Age
summary: Axon Enterprise blew away fourth-quarter estimates after Tuesday's close and set a target for more than doubling sales over the next three years.  Axon stock, which lost half its value amid worry over AI software disruption, leads all S&P 500 stocks on Wednesday.  The maker of Tasers, body cameras, drones and software for law enforcement signaled confidence that it can keep deepening its relationship with law enforcement customers while seizing on its opportunity with enterprises.

content.title: Axon Disarms AI Software Doubts; How Taser Maker Wins In AI Age
content.summary: Axon Enterprise blew away fourth-quarter estimates after Tuesday's close and set a target for more than doubling sales over the next three years.  Axon stock, which lost half its value amid worry over AI software disruption, leads all S&P 500 stocks on Wednesday.  The maker of Tasers, body cameras, drones and software for law enforcement signaled confidence that it can keep deepening its relationship with law enforcement customers while seizing on its opportunity with enterprises.
